alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Nash; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:58PM EDT until August 15 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL WAYNE...SOUTHWESTERN NASH...SOUTHWESTERN WILSON AND CENTRAL JOHNSTON COUNTIES... At 558 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bailey to 12 miles southeast of Zebulon to near Smithfield, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Smithfield, Clayton, Fremont, Bailey, Micro, Selma, Four Oaks, Pine Level, Kenly and Princeton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
